page.title: 04FARMING AROUND AYMESTREY
page.content: There are 15 farms in this area, 12 of about 200 acres and 3 about 50 acres. Most of them are mixed farms of sheep, cattle, cereals and also grown are swedes, potatoes and peas, with a few small cider apple orchards. 2 of the farms have dairy herds and one of the smaller farms breeds{Charollais pedigree bulls.A typical farm will be- 200 acres total, with 200 ewes and 6 rams, 140 head of cattle, 40 acres of a cereal crop,8 acres of a root crop (swedes or potatoes) and the rest as grass for grazing and winter feed. The cattle are mainly cross breeds of {Friesian, Charollais}and{Hereford}and the sheep,{North Country Mules, Welsh {Mules,Clun}and{Suffolk. The farms are run by a family helped by contract labour at times and all the farmers make a reasonable living and are content with their lives.
